reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, believe it or not this game is weirdly fun.

Yes I know it looks dumb. I expected to play it for about 30 seconds and shut it off.

But the interactions with the beach balls are tactile and satisfying, and I enjoyed spawning dozens of them & smashing them with my wooden arms. There's also a simple minigame where you can bounce them through targets for points. Like I said, weirdly fun.

HOWEVER, in its current state I can't recommend it, not even as an EA title. I ran out of things to do in about 10 minutes.

I've played a lot of VR tech demos and this one actually feels ripe for all kinds of little activities. A touch of relaxing music, 2-3 juicier envrionments (a beach would be a nice start) and some more ways to interact with the bouncy balls and you could have a wonderfully theraptic game that would easily be worth $2.99 (or more).

If you want to help the devs come up with ideas to expand on this then it might be worth it, because I do think there's something worth exploring here. Otherwise hang on to your $2.99 for now.

(I'll be keeping an eye on this one & will update my review as it develops)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is the perfect game to play when you're chilling out between a hard game of Space Pirate Trainer or Audioshield. It's relaxing, fun, and there's a bunch of great stuff coming in future releases. I love beach balls!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Plenty fun to be had.  Early days for this game, but it could grow in to quite a nice experience. There's something timeless about trying to get a ball through a hoop... launching the beachballs down the hillside was a nice surprise.

Controls need a bit more explanation and clarity, and a TP feature and Dart Blower would be great to take out some of the beachballs.

But a fun wee distraction which I'll give to some people to play around with during my demos of the Vive :). Thanks for creating and thanks for sharing.
